definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: This article specially discusses this content based en seme scattered reliable historical materials.
sentences.chinese: 本文依據一些散見的可靠史料專門論述這一內容。

sentences.english: Ancient people's understanding of statistic was limited in many given categories.
sentences.chinese: 古人關於文體的認識散見於諸多特定的範疇之中。

sentences.english: Her poems have been published in Qingdao Literature and many others.
sentences.chinese: 詩作散見於《青島文學》《中國詩人報》等報刊。

sentences.english: Military lexis are scattered throughout all kinds of literature, particularly in military works.
sentences.chinese: 這些詞語散見於各種文獻，尤以兵書爲主。

sentences.english: Chen Sanli's poetics scattered among the various characters.
sentences.chinese: 陳三立之詩學旨趣，散見於其存世的各種文字之中。

sentences.english: The records of Pre-Qin scholars, the Qin and Han Dynasties scattered across a variety of literature.
sentences.chinese: 關於先秦諸師的記載，散見於先秦兩漢的多種文獻。

sentences.english: He began to write comics from 1995, and his works is scattered in newspapers and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 1995年開始漫畫創作，作品散見於報刊雜誌。
